item.title: Dynamic search page using Jets
item.description: I've added a search.html page, which is auto-generated by the `rebuild` command, so users can search the website and its posts more easily. The results are presented in a nice list, just like a normal search engine results page.<!--1552731868-->

item.title: Improving SEO with JSON-LD Breadcrumbs
item.description: Using linked data breadcrumbs, we can help search engines map the structure of our site, and owrk out the relationships between pages.<!--1552731868-->

item.title: Unpublishing pages
item.description: An easy way to hide pages on the site, without deleting them, so you can continue working on them, or publish them again later.<!--1552731867-->

item.title: Added a `.gitignore` file
item.description: Only HTML, CSS, JS and other site assets will be deployed to the server - all source files remain on the local machine only.<!--1552731867-->

item.title: Adding HTML and CSS minification
item.description: A new feature has been added to `mdsh` which will improve site performance: automatic minification of the generated HTML and CSS.<!--1552731866-->

item.title: Fixing code formatting
item.description: Another IFS based fix for processing input while retaining any whitespace.<!--1552731866-->

item.title: Enabling easier Markdown re-building
item.description: A new script called `mdsh2md` has been added to the suite of commands available in `mdsh`. This new script makes it easy to build valid Markdown files from the custom `mdsh` format files used when writing posts.<!--1552731866-->

item.title: Setting up your blog
item.description: I've added a couple of scripts that make the initial setup of your blog easier, as well as running the web server.<!--1552731865-->

item.title: Highlighting search terms on the page
item.description: Using a small Cash-JS plugin (adapted from a jQuery plugin), we can easily highlight the users given search terms where they are found on the page.<!--1552731865-->

item.title: Custom CSS and JS for every page
item.description: A simple solution for adding custom CSS and JavaScript to any page or post you create using `mdsh` has now been implemented.<!--1552731864-->

item.title: Searching this website
item.description: I've made it easier to search the website, by enabling Jets powered site search on more pages.<!--1552731864-->

item.title: Fixing RSS generation
item.description: The differences between the GNU and BSD version of `date`, `find` and `sed` caused the RSS feed generation to fail on Mac OS X. So here is how I fixed it.<!--1552731864-->

item.title: Adding authors pages
item.description: Listing all blog post authors, and the posts they've written, in a nice searchable way is now possible in `mdsh`.<!--1552731864-->

item.title: Generating better homepages
item.description: The auto generated homepages have been greatly improved - by default they now list your sites most recent posts in full, instead of listing only the titles of each. This is a much nicer experience for users who land on your homepage.<!--1552731863-->

item.title: Adding a site search feature
item.description: I'm using Jets (https://github.com/NeXTs/Jets.js) for my site search, as it provides very fast, filter-as-you-type page searching.<!--1552731863-->

item.title: Generating an XML sitemap
item.description: Here is a bash script for generating a valid XML sitemap file (sitemap.xml), which can be used to improve the SEO of your website, and improve your Google search rankings.<!--1552731863-->

item.title: Generating an RSS feed
item.description: An RSS feed is a great way to tell users about new content - they can easily subscribe to your RSS feed and be notified when a new post had been published. RSS feeds can be viewed in browser or a dedicated news reader.<!--1552731862-->

item.title: Adding a stylesheet
item.description: Styling this blog to look nicer, and how it works.<!--1552731862-->
